metadata.title: CVE-2021-47064 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mt76:fix potential DMA mapping leak With buf uninitialized inmt76_dma_tx_queue_skb_raw, its field skip_unmap could potentially inherit anon-zero value from stack garbage. If this happens, it will cause DMAmappings for MCU command frames to not be unmapped after completion

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
